description: From Middle English mistrust; equivalent to mis- +‎ trust.

entries.meaning: Lack of trust or confidence; distrust, untrust.

verbs.description: mistrust (third-person singular simple present mistrusts, present participle mistrusting, simple past and past participle mistrusted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To have no confidence in (something or someone).
(transitive) To be wary, suspicious or doubtful of (something or someone).
examples: Mistrust me not thus causeles, for routhe;
Sin to be trewe I have yow plight my trouthe.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To suspect, to imagine or suppose (something) to be the case.
examples: As soon as it was dark enough to conceal our Flight, we assembl’d together, and took a considerable Quantity of Muslins and Callicoes, and hung them upon the Bushes, that the Spies, who we knew watch’d us, might not any ways mistrust our sudden Removal.
She wuz soft in her complexion, her lips, her cheeks, her hands, and as I mistrusted at that first minute, and found out afterwards, soft in her head too.
